title: Skewed and stretched sans-serif logo
content:
Client would like to do a similar logo for a company they recently acquired. I know the logo is some sort of bastardized, stretched-out and skewed version of something but I can't figure out what it is. Likely a fairly common typeface but I can't put my finger on it.

Font: 

 Arial Black 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317113008/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ATK-RGB.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317113008/http:/typophile.com/files/ATK-RGB.jpg) | 101.84 KB |
author: dpiechnik

comments.content: This combination of |S|R|C| smells like a skewed **[Arial Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317113008/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=MS-Windows-Fonts%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Arial%20-%20Black&fid=cd5be9b2c6cdf620fb47f7ca7431dc58&fstyle=i&fsize=36&text=ATK%20OILFIELD%20TRANSPORTATION%20INC.&wrap=2)**

I believe it’s Arial Black (both ATK and Oilfield Transportation Inc.):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/arial/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317113008/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/arial/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/arial/")
